verses.text: Prayer for deliverance from enemies. ¶ For the Chief Musician; Al-tashheth. of David. Michtam; when Saul sent, and they watched the house to kill him.¶ Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God: Set me on high from them that rise up against me.

Deliver me from the workers of iniquity,
    And save me from the bloodthirsty men.
They run and prepare themselves without fault: Awake thou to [a]help me, and behold.

Even thou, O Jehovah God of hosts, the God of Israel,
    Arise to visit all the nations:
    Be not merciful to any wicked transgressors.

They return at evening, they howl like a dog,
    And go round about the city.

But thou, O Jehovah, wilt laugh at them;
    Thou wilt have all the nations in derision.
[b] his strength I will give heed unto thee; For God is my high tower.

footnotes.b: According to Septuagint and Vulgate, My strength.

verses.text: My God with his lovingkindness will meet me: God will let me see upon [c]mine enemies.

footnotes.c: Or, them that lie in wait for me

verses.text: Slay them not, lest my people forget: [d]Scatter them by thy power, and bring them down, O Lord our shield.

footnotes.d: Or, Make them wander to and fro

verses.text:
the sin of their mouth,  the words of their lips,
    Let them even be taken in their pride,
    And for cursing and lying which they speak.

Consume them in wrath, consume them, so that they shall be no more:
    And let them know that God ruleth in Jacob,
    Unto the ends of the earth.

And at evening let them return, let them howl like a dog,
    And go round about the city.

They shall wander up and down for food,
    And tarry all night if they be not satisfied.

But I will sing of thy strength;
    Yea, I will sing aloud of thy lovingkindness in the morning:
    For thou hast been my high tower,
    And a refuge in the day of my distress.

Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing praises:
    For God is my high tower, the God of my mercy.
